DisabledTests.SendEmptyRecords: Bogo allows only 32 empty records to be sent before other TLS messages.
DisabledTests.SendUserCanceledAlerts-TooMany-TLS13: Bogo allows only 5 user canceled alerts to be sent.
DisabledTests.SendWarningAlerts-TooMany: Bogo allows only 5 warning alerts to be sent.
DisabledTests.TooManyKeyUpdates: Bogo allows only 32 KeyUpdate messages to be sent.
DisabledTests.UnsolicitedServerNameAck-TLS*: Boring wants us to fail with an unexpected_extension alert, we simply ignore ssl_server_name_xtn.
DisabledTests.DuplicateCertCompressionExt*: BoGo expects that an alert is sent if more than one compression algorithm is sent.
DisabledTests.*Auth-SHA1-Fallback*: Boring wants us to fall back to SHA-1 if supported_signature_algorithms in CR is empty.
DisabledTests.NoSupportedCurves: This tests a non-spec behavior for TLS 1.2
DisabledTests.SkipEarlyData-*TooMuchData*: Test of internal BoGo features (see Bug 1339373).
DisabledTests.Client-RejectJDK11DowngradeRandom: This random is not specified in RFC8446.
DisabledTests.Renegotiate-Server-Forbidden: TLS 1.2 test, renegotiation is allowed in NSS.
DisabledTests.EmptySessionID-TLS13: This test also asserts BoringSSL always sending CCS messages for compatibility mode.
DisabledTests.Http*: Test sends http string to socket before handshake. his data is interpreted as a record header and leads to different IO errors in NSS.
DisabledTests.V2ClientHello*: Prefix data before V2 ClientHello leads to IO errors in NSS.
DisabledTests.Resume-Server-UnofferedCipher-TLS13: Bogo rejects resumption if client offers previously not used ciphersuites with equal hash algorithm (no 0Rtt).
DisabledTests.EarlyData-FirstTicket-Server-TLS13: Bogo provides specific early data logging which is the only check in this test but not supported by NSS.
DisabledTests.*NoSSL3*: Test passes but only because of handshake failure, NSS only rejects SSL3 immediately in TLS1.3 clients/servers.
DisabledTests.CheckRecordVersion-TLS1: NSS doesn't check record version field. Bug 1317634
DisabledTests.CheckRecordVersion-TLS11: NSS doesn't check record version field. Bug 1317634
DisabledTests.CheckRecordVersion-TLS12: NSS doesn't check record version field. Bug 1317634
DisabledTests.GarbageInitialRecordVersion-TLS*: NSS doesn't strictly check the ClientHello record version.
DisabledTests.DuplicateKeyShares*: NSS doesn't check for duplicates. Bug 1304578
DisabledTests.PointFormat-Client-MissingUncompressed: NSS ignores ec_point_formats extensions sent by servers.
DisabledTests.SkipEarlyData-Interleaved-TLS13: NSS ignores invalid early data records by default since ssl_0rtt_ignore_trial is default. Bug 1336916
DisabledTests.ECDSAKeyUsage*: NSS only checks KeyUsage on server setup and with delegated credential verification. Bug 1338194
DisabledTests.RSAKeyUsage-*-WantSignature-GotEncipherm: NSS only checks KeyUsage on server setup and with delegated credential verification. See Bug 1338194
DisabledTests.TLS13-ExpectNoSessionTicketOnBadKEMode-S: NSS Server side bug. Don't send ticket when not permitted by KE modes (Bug 1317635)
DisabledTests.Resume-Server-OmitPSKsOnSecondClientHell: NSS Server side bug. It does not detect ClientHello dropping of PSK extension (after HRR).
DisabledTests.Renegotiate-Client-Forbidden-1: By default NSS allows renegotiation with extension contrary to bogo.
DisabledTests.TrailingData*: NSS does only check for trailing data on possible key change handshake messages in TLS 1.3
DisabledTests.*ECH*SkipInvalidPublicName*: NSS allows hostnames to include underscores in contrary to the spec. Bug 1136616
DisabledTests.*ECH*CompressSupportedVersions: NSS never compresses supported versions, Bogo does if CHOuter is TLS 1.3 only (equal to CHInner).
DisabledTests.*ECH*NoSupportedConfigs*: NSS throws error if unsupported but well formed retry configs could not be set on client, Bogo just does not offer ECH.
DisabledTests.*ECH*RandomHRR*: NSS sends real ECH in CH2 after receiving HRR rejcting ECH formally, Bogo expects instant ech_required alert. Bug 1779357
DisabledTests.*ECH*UnsolicitedInnerServerNameAck: NSS always sends SNI in CHInner, Bogo tests if the client detects an unsolicited SNI in SH if CHInner did not include it. Bug 1781224
DisabledTests.CorruptTicket-TLS-TLS12: NSS sends an alert on reception of a corrupted session ticket instead of falling back to full handshake. Bug 1783812
DisabledTests.FalseStart-ALPN*: TODO - Implementing TLS 1.2 only FalseStart has low priority.
DisabledTests.BadRSAClientKeyExchange-*: This is a TLS11 only test.
DisabledTests.RSAKeyUsage-Server-WantSignature-GotSign: Only Server side of TLS 1 fails
Only Server side of TLS 11 fails
